sub_topic: Finding the vertex cover of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
     1
   / | \
  2--3--4
 / \ | / \
5---6---7
```

What is the minimum vertex cover of this graph?
message_2: A minimum vertex cover is a smallest set of vertices such that every edge in the graph is incident to at least one vertex in the set. In this graph, the minimum vertex cover is {1, 6, 4}, as it covers all the edges and consists of 3 vertices.
